svcproc.title: Hendrickson Technical Publication
svcproc.para: The following procedure is to acquaint and assist maintenance personnel when adjustment to the rebound control assembly is required.

For proper suspension performance, the rebound control assembly as shown in Figure 1 should be adjusted so that the threaded washer contacts the rebound spring when the vehicle is empty. The adjustment must be made after the body is installed, and during an empty vehicle condition. If the vehicle is equipped with lift axle(s), they must be in the raised position during this procedure. After the adjustment is complete tighten the jam nut to 17-23 foot pounds torque.
The adjustable rebound bumper assembly prevents the overextension of the bolster springs during empty vehicle operation.

If it is required to replace the rebound control assembly the following procedure is recommended. Remove the rebound spring control rod jam nut, threaded washer, and rebound control spring. Remove the rebound bumper control rod clevis locknut and bolt, and remove the control rod and clevis assembly.

Install the rebound spring control rod and clevis through the saddle bracket and position the clevis on the equalizing beam mounting tab. Install the clevis bolt and locknut. Tighten the locknut but do not pinch clevis up tight. The clevis must be free to rotate.Install the new rebound spring, threaded washer, and jam nut on control rod above the saddle bracket. Tighten the jam nut to 17 to 23 foot pounds torque.

The threaded washer must contact the rebound spring when the vehicle is empty. The adjustment must be made after the body is installed, and during an empty vehicle condition. After the adjustment is made, tighten the jam nut to 17-23 ft-lbs. torque.
